shortlist.name: Settle Down Jill (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and runner-up finish indicate peak form and fitness. Dan Skelton is a high-percentage trainer, and the odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in recent runs, making her the most reliable option among the field[3][7].

shortlist.name: No No Fizz (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins last campaign and a solid placing on reappearance. Fergal O'Brien is a respected trainer, and the odds suggest genuine winning chance. Recent form is competitive, though not as sharp as Settle Down Jill’s last two runs[3][7].

shortlist.name: Back In The Bay (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins and a second from last three starts, indicating both fitness and consistency. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Odds reflect strong market support, confirming status as the one to beat.

shortlist.name: At Mangan Bridge (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and improving form figures. Trainer and jockey are reliable at this level. Market rates him close to the favourite, suggesting he is the main danger if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Sixpack
shortlist.rationale: Sixpack is a strong market favourite, indicating significant confidence from both bookmakers and exchange layers. While lacking published form, the support in the market suggests positive reports from connections or strong homework. James Owen is a capable trainer, and the booking of Alex Chadwick is notable for this type of event. The lack of form is a minor concern, but the odds and connections point to a likely strong showing.

shortlist.name: Zafaan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Zafaan (Ire) brings consistent recent form, placing in both starts this season and showing reliability at this level. The horse has not finished out of the frame in its last two runs, suggesting fitness and competitiveness. Charlie Clover is a respected trainer, and Harry Bannister is a positive jockey booking. The odds reflect genuine win claims without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Blue Universe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two placed efforts since returning from a break, including a strong third last time. Proven ability to compete at this level and holds the best overall profile in the field. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Breezethroughlife (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Promising debut third, showing ability and scope for improvement. Trainer and jockey combination is respected at this level. With natural progression, rates a major threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: The Clonmel Kid (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.35 exchange (well-supported, not far behind market leaders)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple seconds and thirds at similar grade. Recent third on seasonal return suggests fitness and reliability. Connections capable and horse is proven at the trip.

shortlist.name: Police Academy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.8 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently placed at this level last season, now drops in grade after a pipe-opener. Fergal O'Brien is a high-percentage trainer at this track and the market support is notable. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Shadows In The Sky (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.95 exchange (solid second choice, well clear of outsiders)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple placed efforts and wins this season. Proven at the track and trip, and connections are in form. Reliable type who runs to his mark and should be in the mix again.

shortlist.name: Taxus Baccata (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 5 exchange (third pick, still within main market group)
shortlist.rationale: Has winning form at this level and shaped as if needing the run on reappearance. Tom Cannon is a positive jockey booking. If coming on for that run, profiles as a strong contender without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Carlton
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this season. Proven ability to compete at this level, and current odds reflect strong market support. Connections are reliable and the horse is holding form well, indicating readiness to win again.

shortlist.name: Gone In Sixty
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with several recent placings and a win this season. Form suggests reliability and competitiveness in similar company. Odds indicate respect from the market, and the horse does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Dartmouth Rose
shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 4.3 exchange (well-fancied, close in market to top two)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show three consecutive placings, indicating the horse is in good heart and knocking on the door for a win. Market support is strong, and the horse is proven at this level. No evidence of needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Coedana (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.9 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing progression and consistency. Connections are in good order and the horse is fit, with no sign of regression. Odds are short but justified by recent performance and reliability.

shortlist.name: Contacto
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, with solid placed efforts and a recent return to form. Trainer and jockey are both respected, and current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability in similar company.

shortlist.name: High Point (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.1 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals a return to form after a mixed campaign. Top jockey booking and competitive odds suggest connections expect another strong showing. Has the ability to follow up if maintaining latest improvement.

shortlist.name: Accredit
shortlist.rationale: Accredit has top connections, strong recent form with a win and a place, and is a very short price on both fixed odds and exchange, indicating market confidence. The Gosden stable excels with progressive types and C. T. Keane is a reliable jockey. No signs of decline and no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Eternal Force
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with back-to-back wins, indicating peak form. Top connections (Haggas/Marquand) and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression and recent form is superior to rivals.

shortlist.name: Angel Hunter
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.6 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time out, suggesting improvement and fitness. Consistent performer for a leading yard, and odds indicate genuine support. Recent win shows readiness to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Illy's Roo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.2 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out, showing clear improvement and ability to win at this level. Top jockey booked and strong connections. Recent form is progressive and fits the profile of a horse peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Come On Over (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close second last time, indicating readiness to win. Odds reflect market respect. Connections in good form and the horse is holding condition well.

shortlist.name: Splish Splash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive races, strong connections, and clear market favorite status. The 34 form suggests minor improvement is possible, and the odds reflect genuine confidence in a horse already operating near its peak[4].

shortlist.name: Zooming
shortlist.rationale: Unraced but from a top yard and with a leading jockey booked. The odds suggest market respect for debutants from this stable, and the connections are a major positive. However, lack of form means some risk is inherent.

shortlist.name: Havana Flower
shortlist.rationale: Recent poor run (9) is a concern, but the trainer/jockey combination is strong and the horse is not a complete outsider. Odds may overstate the risk if the last run was an aberration, but improvement is needed.

shortlist.name: Kinswoman
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.86 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two seconds in last four starts, indicating peak fitness and reliability. Top connections with Marquand and Haggas add further confidence. Short odds reflect justified market strength.

shortlist.name: Trilby
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with two consecutive placed efforts, suggesting readiness to win. Odds indicate market respect and not an outsider. Jockey booking is positive for a horse trending upward.

shortlist.name: Brazilian Belle (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.5 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple recent placings and a win in last 6 starts. Connections are in good form and the booking of Billy Loughnane is a positive. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and she does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Secret Mistral
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Reliable at this grade with a recent win and several placings. Rossa Ryan is a notable jockey booking. Form is steady and odds indicate genuine respect from the market. Should be competitive if repeating best recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Niminy Piminy (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.3 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes following a win; lightly raced this season and holding form well. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Market support is strong, indicating confidence.

shortlist.name: Census (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a recent third; lightly raced and open to further improvement. Top yard and jockey combination. Odds reflect solid support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Big Win (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a solid third last time, suggesting readiness to win. Trained by Harry Charlton, a respected yard, and holds clear market support as favourite. No need for major improvement to feature strongly.

shortlist.name: Star Cast
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two recent runner-up finishes, indicating reliability at this level. Market respect and solid form make this runner a logical contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Romeo Montague
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with a recent win and a third, suggesting upward progression. Current odds reflect strong market support, and connections are capable. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Ten Carat Harry
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite on exchange at 3.95, value compared to SBK 9/1
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and a solid third last time indicate consistent form. Exchange odds suggest significant market respect, and the Osborne stable is reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Empirestateofmind (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.55 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, winning last time and consistently placing in recent starts. Connections are reliable and the odds reflect strong confidence. No sign of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Cephalus
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but includes a win and a close third in higher grade. Connections are respected and current odds indicate market respect. Capable of bouncing back if returning to best.

shortlist.name: Mr Mistoffelees (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts; top connections; shortest odds in the field reflect strong market confidence; no major improvement needed—already at peak form[1][4].

shortlist.name: Urban Road
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures (23111234) show a horse knocking on the door with multiple wins and places; odds offer value relative to proven ability; reliable jockey/trainer combination; no major improvement required—already competitive at this level[1][3].

shortlist.name: Paladin (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form includes a recent win and solid placed efforts; respected trainer and jockey; odds reflect fair value for a horse with proven winning ability; no major improvement needed—already shown winning form[1][4].

shortlist.name: Coramento
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent second-place finishes showing reliability. Market leader with solid odds suggesting strong professional backing. Form figures of 4242 in last four runs demonstrate stable, competitive performances without decline.

shortlist.name: One More Bottle
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form improvement with back-to-back wins (33) followed by competitive placings (42). Progressing nicely and holds form well. Attractive odds value at 7/1 given current trajectory and consistency.

shortlist.name: Ring Of Gold
shortlist.rationale: Last-time-out winner with back-to-back victories (11) showing peak form. Easterby training team provides strong connections. Recent winning sequence demonstrates horse is in excellent current condition at 6/1 odds.

shortlist.name: Woodrafff
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (1) with consistent placings (341) in latest runs. Ruth Carr is respected trainer. Solid form profile without major gaps or poor performances. Reasonable odds value as potential winner.

shortlist.name: Second Fiddle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with four consecutive wins, indicating clear improvement and sustained performance. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression yet, and profile suggests further success is likely at this level.

shortlist.name: Electric Avenue
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 4/1 SBK, 5.8 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, placing second last time and showing ability to compete at this level. Jockey booking is notable and odds are fair for an each-way or win contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Barleybrown
shortlist.rationale: Regularly runs well in similar company and has a top jockey booked. While not winning recently, form is reliable and odds are competitive for a horse likely to be in the mix if the favourite falters.

shortlist.name: Night Mission (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with consistent placings (2nd, 3rd). Well-backed favorite with sharp odds indicating market confidence. Kevin Stott is a capable jockey and the horse shows progression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Harswell Angel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Competitive odds at 15/4 offer decent value against the short-priced favorite. Recent form shows consistency with mid-field finishes. Roger Fell yard capable of producing improvers, and Mark Winn rides regularly for the stable.

shortlist.name: Regal Dream
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form and strong odds value make Regal Dream a top contender. Kevin Ryan's training and Tom Eaves' jockey skills add to its potential.

shortlist.name: Bella Delizia
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows potential, and odds are reasonable. Bella Delizia could challenge for a top spot with a good run.

shortlist.name: Beyond The Bar (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with third and second place finishes. Strong trainer-jockey combination with Tim Easterby and David Allan. Clear market leader at short odds reflecting confidence. Progressive profile without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Pantile's Gift
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form including a win (indicated by '7' position then '3' then '2'). Competitive odds suggest market respect. Andrew Mullen provides experienced riding. Represents value against the favorite with proven winning ability.

shortlist.name: Maxwellcan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Jason Hart and Charlie Johnston are top-tier Northern connections. Recent sixth place finish shows competitive involvement. Odds of 10/3 provide value if returning to best form. Strong stable could have runner primed for improvement.

shortlist.name: Without Flaw (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a close second in last five starts. Shortest exchange price in the field, indicating strong market confidence. No sign of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Monks Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals return to form. Trainer and jockey are reliable at this venue. Odds are competitive and reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Showtime Mahomes
shortlist.rationale: Favorable odds and recent form suggest potential for a strong performance. The trainer-jockey combination could also be beneficial.

shortlist.name: Missmimi
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and competitive odds make Missmimi a contender. Recent performances indicate a strong chance of placing.

shortlist.name: Minnesota Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed, but odds suggest value. Could be a dark horse with the right conditions.

shortlist.name: Reginald Charles
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings this season, indicating reliability and peak condition. Connections are experienced, and current odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in latest runs.

shortlist.name: Oscar's Sister (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with two runner-up finishes, suggesting readiness to win. Trainer is respected and the horse has shown ability at this level. Odds indicate market confidence and value for a progressive profile.

shortlist.name: Knightmare (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with two solid fourth-place finishes, indicating potential for further improvement. Connections are capable, and odds suggest the market expects a competitive run. No major negatives in recent form.

shortlist.name: Lumenbourg
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with consistent placings including two wins in last eight starts. Form figures show no finish worse than third in last six races, indicating peak form and consistency. Well-backed at favorable odds given the competitive field.

shortlist.name: Yafaarr (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent improvement trend with three consecutive placings including a win two runs back. Form shows progression from mid-division to competitive finishes. Tom Eaves adds proven jockey strength. Joint-favorite status justified by current trajectory.

shortlist.name: Evocative Spark (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Two recent second-place finishes demonstrate current competitive form. Consistent performer who regularly hits the frame. Odds offer value against the shorter-priced favorites given recent placings and proven class level.

shortlist.name: Salaria (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing consistent improvement with three consecutive top-three finishes (331). Market confidence evident as clear favourite. Recent wins demonstrate horse is in peak form and connections are in good touch.

shortlist.name: Pride Of Nepal
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple second-place finishes showing reliability. Tony Carroll is a capable trainer in amateur races. Exchange odds of 4.6 suggest market sees value, significantly shorter than bookmaker price indicates potential overlay.

shortlist.name: Masekela (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Tim Easterby is a top-class northern trainer with excellent strike rate. Recent form shows consistency with multiple fourth-place finishes, suggesting horse is competitive at this level. Exchange price represents reasonable value for Easterby-trained runner.

shortlist.name: Laurens Bay (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/9 SBK, 1.49 exchange (strong favourite, very short odds)
shortlist.rationale: Laurens Bay (Fr) has an outstanding recent form profile, including multiple wins and consistent top-two finishes, indicating peak fitness and reliability. The horse is trained by Jamie Snowden, a respected trainer, and ridden by Gavin Sheehan, a top jockey, further boosting confidence. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest a high probability of success, with no evidence of decline or need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Storming George (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win followed by fifth. Heavily backed market leader with solid connections. Jack Quinlan is an experienced jockey and Neil King fields consistent performers. Form suggests horse is fit and ready, with the win indicating current ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Shabalko D'herm (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time out shows competitive form. Twiston-Davies family operation is highly successful with strong strike rate. Sam Twiston-Davies is a top-level jockey. French-bred with limited runs suggests potential for improvement. Represents genuine each-way value at the odds.

shortlist.name: White Riot (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Mixed recent form but shows a win and second place earlier in sequence. Fergal O'Brien is a prolific trainer with excellent results. The slash indicates a break which could mean freshened up. Woods is a capable jockey. Odds offer value if returning to earlier winning form.

shortlist.name: Mikhailovich (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win and a close second, suggesting current sharpness. Top connections and a leading jockey. Odds represent fair value for a horse in form and with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Another Lord (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and has been in the frame in most recent starts. Trainer-jockey combination is in form. Slightly longer odds than the favorite but still a strong contender based on recent performances.

shortlist.name: Golden Ambition (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to win and place in competitive races. Trainer is respected, and jockey is capable. Form is solid if not spectacular, but odds are attractive for a horse with proven class.

shortlist.name: Lookaway (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with consecutive runner-up finishes followed by a win last time out. Market leader reflects consistent performance pattern and current fitness. Proven at this level with three wins from recent runs.

shortlist.name: Minella Rescue (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form finishing first or second in last four starts. Progressive profile with back-to-back wins in latest two runs suggests horse reaching peak form. Competent Sean Bowen booking adds value at the odds.

shortlist.name: Brave Knight
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins including hat-trick earlier in form string. Elite Nicholls/Cobden combination represents top-tier connections. Recent third shows retention of form and represents each-way value against shorter-priced rivals.

shortlist.name: Koapey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent win, suggesting fitness and readiness. Competitive odds.

shortlist.name: My Friend Sean (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent strong form with a win, indicating peak fitness. Odds offer value given the form.

shortlist.name: Dog Fox
shortlist.rationale: Recent improvement in form, though the unplaced run is a concern. Odds reflect potential.

shortlist.name: Dinofromberlais (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time out, indicating improvement and fitness. Top connections with Sean Bowen and Olly Murphy, both in strong form. Market support is significant, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Cuban Court (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with two wins to end last campaign, showing progressive form. Reliable connections and proven ability to win in similar company. Odds reflect strong market respect and he does not require significant improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: Sapphos Word (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a respected yard with a good record in bumpers. Market support is significant, suggesting strong stable confidence. No form shown but connections and price indicate readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: She's Delighted
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 6.4 exchange (well-fancied, slight drift on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: From a top yard for this type of race and has a capable amateur jockey. Market position is strong despite a slight drift, and the stable excels with newcomers in bumpers.

shortlist.name: Harry The Rogue (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 (SBK), 3.65 (exchange) – clear market leader, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent with a string of placed efforts, repeatedly knocking on the door at this level. Recent form figures show reliability and fitness, and the market support confirms strong expectations. Connections are solid and the horse does not require improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: God Of Thunder (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 (SBK), 3 (exchange) – strong in the market, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win this season and competitive efforts in similar company. Trainer is adept at placing horses at Dundalk, and the odds reflect genuine support. No major improvement needed; proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Powerful Hook Head (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple competitive finishes, including a close third last time. Trained by a top yard, suggesting further improvement is possible but not required to win at this level. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Drucker (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, recent win and placed efforts show current form. Trainer/jockey combination is solid. Odds are fair for a proven contender.

shortlist.name: Cala Bonita (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed form, suggesting peak fitness. Trainer in form. Slightly shorter odds but justified by recent success.

shortlist.name: Faro Island
shortlist.rationale: Last run a win, indicating sharp current form. Trainer and jockey reliable. Odds represent value for a horse with upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Grey Fable (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent earlier in career, recent runs less convincing but capable of bouncing back at a track he's performed well at before. Odds offer value if returning to best.

shortlist.name: Star Harbour (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong recent form showing 2nd and 4th in last two starts. McGuinness/Coen combination is proven at Dundalk. Current odds reflect solid chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Longbourn (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with 3rd, 1st, 2nd in last three qualifying runs. Won two starts back, showing current fitness and ability at this level. Represents solid each-way value.

shortlist.name: Dancing Saxon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive maidens, now faces a winnable opportunity. Top connections (O'Brien/McMonagle) and strong market support indicate confidence. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Savile Row (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 4.6 Exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with consistent placed efforts in similar company. Trained by Aidan O'Brien, suggesting further improvement is possible. Reliable form and strong connections make him a key contender.

shortlist.name: Sovereign Thought (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a win, indicating peak form. Represents a top yard and has shown ability to win at this level. Market support and recent improvement are positives.

shortlist.name: Bowman (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and consistent performances, making it a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Lorr's Girl (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement and consistency, making it a viable option.

shortlist.name: Colugo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a third place, indicating potential for a strong finish.

shortlist.name: Drafted (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a strong second last time out. Trained by Charles Byrnes, a respected operator, and holds clear market support as favourite. No signs of regression in form and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Half Nutz (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent efforts, notably a close fourth last time, and has been holding form in similar company. Odds indicate strong market respect and he is not a longshot. Connections are capable and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Distillate
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and a third, showing ability to compete at this level. Trained by Adrian McGuinness, who is adept with all-weather runners at Dundalk. Market position suggests connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: Shelbourne Flyer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second and third in similar contests, indicating current form is strong. Jockey booking is positive and trainer has a good record at Dundalk. Not a longshot and should be competitive again.

shortlist.name: Tokenomics (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, including a strong run last time out. Connections are reliable and the horse is well-supported in the market, indicating confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers.

shortlist.name: Hightimeyouwon
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with several wins and a runner-up finish, showing consistency and ability at this level. Odds are competitive and connections have proven capable in similar contests.

shortlist.name: Daamberdiplomat (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer is highly respected and the horse is well-supported in the market. Recent form is mixed but includes a win and competitive efforts, suggesting potential to bounce back in this field.

shortlist.name: Washington Street (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, trained by a top yard, and partnered by a leading jockey. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for a win.

shortlist.name: Ballintogher (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with recent placed efforts, showing readiness to win. Odds indicate strong support and connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Warofdynamite (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent starts, now faces a weaker field and is well-supported in the market. Muzi Yeni is a top local jockey, and the trainer has a solid record at Fairview. No major improvement needed; fitness and class edge apparent.

shortlist.name: Bahamian Beat (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Richard Fourie is one of South Africa's leading jockeys and Greeff is a top Fairview trainer. Market support is notable despite lack of published form, suggesting strong stable confidence and likely readiness. Connections alone justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Timeline (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement and ability to place. Trainer Strydom is respected locally, and Timeline has shown enough consistency to be competitive at this level. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven ability.

shortlist.name: Mio Destino (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, with multiple placings indicating readiness to win. Luyolo Mxothwa is a capable jockey and Kotzen's runners are often well-prepared. No major improvement required; should be in the mix.

shortlist.name: Prolific Star (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in recent starts, rarely out of the frame, and partnered by a leading jockey. The stable is in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Odds represent fair value for a horse with this profile.

shortlist.name: Stand Up (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Shows solid consistency with multiple placed efforts. Trainer and jockey are experienced, and the horse is clearly in form. The odds are justified given the reliability shown in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Grey Warrior (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, with a win and a close-up third last time out. Top jockey booking and a respected trainer add confidence. The horse is clearly on an upward curve and is well found in the market.

shortlist.name: Pibe De Oro (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placed efforts. The trainer is in form and the jockey is capable. Slightly bigger odds offer a touch of value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Aethelwulf (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form has improved markedly, with two thirds in better company. The booking of a top jockey is a positive, and the odds are fair for a horse that is clearly on the up.

shortlist.name: Green Isle (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.83 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with strong recent form (1-1-3 last three starts), indicating peak fitness and consistency. Top local jockey Richard Fourie is booked, and trainer Greeff is highly respected at Fairview. The odds reflect strong market confidence and align with the horse's upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Family Power (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is excellent, with two wins in last three starts and a runner-up finish last time. Proven ability to win in this grade and remains in top condition. Trainer Smith is reliable, and the odds suggest strong support without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Ginger Delight (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint second favorite at 2.72 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: While not as prolific as the top two, Ginger Delight has been running consistently in competitive fields and now faces a winnable opportunity. Jockey Mxothwa is a positive booking, and the market support is notable. Should be considered for exotics and as a value alternative.

shortlist.name: Wishes And Dreams (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistent improvement with a win in the last race, indicating strong current form.

shortlist.name: East Coast Girl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win suggests good form, and odds offer value compared to the favorite.

shortlist.name: Mercantour (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent wins, strong trainer and jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Bingwa (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows some inconsistency but remains competitive with decent odds value.

shortlist.name: Brenden James (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins suggest improving form, making it a viable contender.

shortlist.name: Red William (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Superior recent form with three consecutive wins (111) showing peak fitness and progression. Consistent placements before current winning streak demonstrate reliability. Strong jockey-trainer combination with proven class at this level. Offers value at current odds given winning momentum.

shortlist.name: Roll Of The Dice (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with back-to-back third-place finishes showing steady improvement. Form pattern (1133) indicates horse is finding its stride and nearing peak performance. Competitive odds provide value for a runner showing upward trajectory without requiring major improvement.

shortlist.name: One Religion (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong jockey Richard Fourie aboard. Recent form shows second-place finish (2) after fourth-place run, indicating competitive performances at this level. Greeff stable in good form. Short odds reflect market confidence though recent consistency mixed.

shortlist.name: Guy Gibson (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and favored odds suggest a high likelihood of winning. The trainer-jockey combination is also notable.

shortlist.name: Vulcanite (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows inconsistency, but competitive odds and past wins indicate potential for a strong performance.

shortlist.name: French Flame (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Form suggests some consistency, and odds are competitive, making it a viable contender.

shortlist.name: Cherry Oh Baby (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent recent form with multiple seconds and a win last time out. Top local jockey and trainer combination. Profile suggests reliability and readiness, with no signs of decline. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: King Rahul (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals improvement and ability to deliver at this level. Trainer in good local form. Odds indicate solid market support, and recent form is competitive.

shortlist.name: King Viserys (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Back-to-back wins in latest starts show marked progress and readiness. Connections are capable, and odds offer value for a horse peaking at the right time.
